go:term.go:name: molecular_function
go:term.go:definition: Elemental activities, such as catalysis or binding, describing the actions of a gene product at the molecular level. A given gene product may exhibit one or more molecular functions.

go:term.go:name: antioxidant activity
go:term.go:definition: Inhibition of the reactions brought about by dioxygen (O2) or peroxides. Usually the antioxidant is effective because it can itself be more easily oxidized than the substance protected. The term is often applied to components that can trap free radicals, thereby breaking the chain reaction that normally leads to extensive biological damage.

go:term.go:name: glutathione dehydrogenase (ascorbate) activity
go:term.go:definition: Catalysis of the reaction: 2 glutathione + dehydroascorbate = glutathione disulfide + ascorbate.

go:term.go:name: glutathione-disulfide reductase activity
go:term.go:definition: Catalysis of the reaction: 2 glutathione + NADP+ = glutathione disulfide + NADPH + H+.
go:term.go:comment: Note that this function was formerly EC:1.6.4.2.

go:term.go:name: peroxidase activity
go:term.go:definition: Catalysis of the reaction: donor + H2O2 = oxidized donor + 2 H2O.

go:term.go:name: thioredoxin-disulfide reductase activity
go:term.go:definition: Catalysis of the reaction: NADPH + H+ + oxidized thioredoxin = NADP+ + reduced thioredoxin.

go:term.go:name: binding
go:term.go:definition: The selective and stoichiometric interaction of a molecule with one or more specific sites on another molecule.
go:term.go:comment: Note that ligand is being used in its broadest biological sense. For ligands that bind to signal transducing receptors, consider the molecular function term 'receptor binding ; GO:0005102' and its children.

go:dbxref.go:reference: 18070 147 Transport and binding proteins Other > GO:transporter ; GO:0005215
18080 141 Transport and binding proteins Unknown substrate > GO:transporter ; GO:0005215
TIGR01115 photosynthetic reaction center M subunit
TIGR01150 photosynthetic reaction center H subunit
TIGR01157 photosynthetic reaction center L subunit

go:term.go:name: acyl binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with an acyl group, any group formally derived by removal of the hydroxyl group from the acid function of a carboxylic acid.

go:term.go:name: amino acid binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with an amino acid, organic acids containing one or more amino substituents.

go:term.go:name: glutamate binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with glutamate, the anion of 2-aminopentanedioic acid.

go:term.go:name: glycine binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with glycine, aminoethanoic acid.

go:term.go:name: antigen binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with an antigen, any substance which is capable of inducing a specific immune response and of reacting with the products of that response, the specific antibody or specifically sensitized T-lymphocytes, or both. Binding may counteract the biological activity of the antigen.

go:term.go:name: lipid antigen binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with a lipid antigen.

go:term.go:name: endogenous lipid antigen binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with an endogenous cellular lipid antigen.

go:term.go:name: exogenous lipid antigen binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with an exogenous lipid antigen (examples include microbial lipids and glycolipids).

go:term.go:name: peptide antigen binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with an antigen peptide, a fragment of a foreign protein derived by proteolysis within the cell.
go:term.go:comment: Note that this term can be used to describe binding to the peptide expressed by an MHC molecule.

go:term.go:name: endogenous peptide antigen binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with an antigen peptide, a fragment of an endogenous foreign protein, derived by proteolysis within the cell.
go:term.go:comment: Note that this term can be used to describe binding to the peptide expressed by an MHC molecule.

go:term.go:name: exogenous peptide antigen binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with an antigen peptide, a fragment of an exogenous foreign protein derived by endocytosis of the protein and proteolysis within the cell.
go:term.go:comment: Note that this term can be used to describe binding to the peptide expressed by an MHC molecule.

go:term.go:name: toxin binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with a toxin, a poisonous substance that causes damage to biological systems. Toxins are differentiated from simple chemical poisons and vegetable alkaloids by their high molecular weight and antigenicity (they elicit an antibody response).

go:term.go:name: bacterial binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with any part of a bacterial cell.

go:term.go:name: Gram-negative bacterial binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with any part of a Gram-negative bacterial cell.

go:term.go:name: boron binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with boron, the group 13 element with properties which are borderline between metals and non-metals.

go:term.go:name: calcium oxalate binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with calcium oxalate, CaC2O4, a salt of oxalic acid. In animals, it may be excreted in urine or retained in the form of urinary calculi.

go:term.go:name: carbohydrate binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with any carbohydrate.

go:term.go:name: polysaccharide binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with any polysaccharide.

go:term.go:name: cellulose binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with cellulose.

go:term.go:name: chitin binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with chitin, a linear polysaccharide consisting of P-1,4-linked N-acetyl-D-glucosamine residues.

go:term.go:name: galacturonan binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with any simple or complex galacturonan. Galacturonan is any glycan composed solely of galacturonic acid residues, a specific type of glycuronan, and a constituent of some pectins.

go:term.go:name: polysaccharide receptor activity
go:term.go:definition: Combining with a polysaccharide to initiate a change in cell activity.

go:term.go:name: zymosan receptor activity
go:term.go:definition: Combining with zymosan to initiate a change in cell activity.

go:term.go:name: zymosan binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with zymosan.

go:term.go:name: sugar binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with any mono-, di- or trisaccharide carbohydrate.

go:term.go:name: disaccharide binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with any disaccharide. Disaccharides are sugars composed of two monosaccharide units.

go:term.go:name: lactose binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with lactose, a disaccharide of glucose and galactose, the carbohydrate of milk.

go:term.go:name: monosaccharide binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with any monosaccharide. Monosaccharides are the simplest carbohydrates; they are polyhydric alcohols containing either an aldehyde or a keto group and between three to ten or more carbon atoms. They form the constitutional repeating units of oligo- and polysaccharides.

go:term.go:name: fucose binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with fucose, a 5-carbon (pentose) sugar.

go:term.go:name: galactose binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with galactose (galacto-hexose), a common constituent of many oligo- and polysaccharides.

go:term.go:name: galactoside binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with any glycoside in which the sugar moiety is galactose.

go:term.go:name: galacturonate binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with any galacturonate. Galacturonate is the anion of galacturonic acid, the uronic acid formally derived from galactose by oxidation of the hydroxymethylene group at C-6 to a carboxyl group.

go:term.go:name: glucose binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with the D- and L-enantiomers of glucose.

go:term.go:name: mannose binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with mannose, a monosaccharide hexose, stereoisomeric with glucose, that occurs naturally only in polymerized forms called mannans.

go:term.go:name: N-acetylgalactosamine binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with N-acetylgalactosamine, 2-acetamido-2-deoxygalactopyranose, the n-acetyl derivative of galactosamine.

go:term.go:name: trisaccharide binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with any trisaccharide. Trisaccharides are sugars composed of three monosaccharide units.

go:term.go:name: cofactor binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with any of various non-protein organic cofactors that are required, in addition to an enzyme and a substrate, for an enzymatic reaction to proceed.

go:term.go:name: coenzyme binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with a coenzyme, any nonprotein organic cofactor that is required (in addition to an enzyme and a substrate) for a reaction to proceed.

go:term.go:name: FAD binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with FAD, flavin-adenine dinucleotide, the coenzyme or the prosthetic group of various flavoprotein oxidoreductase enzymes.

go:term.go:name: FMN binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with FMN, flavin mononucleotide, the coenzyme or the prosthetic group of various flavoprotein oxidoreductase enzymes.

go:term.go:name: NADPH binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with NADPH, reduced nicotinamide-adenine dinucleotide phosphate, a coenzyme involved in many redox and biosynthetic reactions.

go:term.go:name: quinone binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with a quinone, any member of a class of diketones derivable from aromatic compounds by conversion of two CH groups into CO groups with any necessary rearrangement of double bonds.

go:term.go:name: ubiquinone binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with ubiquinone, a quinone derivative with a tail of isoprenoid units.

go:term.go:name: drug binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with a drug, any naturally occurring or synthetic substance, other than a nutrient, that, when administered or applied to an organism, affects the structure or functioning of the organism; in particular, any such substance used in the diagnosis, prevention, or treatment of disease.

go:term.go:name: cocaine binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with cocaine (2-beta-carbomethoxy-3-beta-benzoxytropane), an alkaloid obtained from dried leaves of the South American shrub Erythroxylon coca or by chemical synthesis.

go:term.go:name: cyclosporin A binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with cyclosporin A, a cyclic undecapeptide that contains several N-methylated and unusual amino acids.

go:term.go:name: diazepam binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with diazepam, one of the most widely used benzodiazepine drugs. It is used as an anti-anxiety-hypnotic agent and has the proprietary name Valium.

go:term.go:name: macrolide binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with a macrolide, any of a large group of structurally related antibiotics produced by Streptomyces species.

go:term.go:name: FK506 binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with the immunosuppressant FK506.

go:term.go:name: N-1-naphthylphthalamic acid binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with N-1-naphthylphthalamic acid, an auxin transport inhibitor.

go:term.go:name: phenylalkylamine binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with phenylalkylamine or any of its derivatives.

go:term.go:name: thienylcyclohexylpiperidine binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with thienylcyclohexylpiperidine.

go:term.go:name: extracellular matrix binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with a component of the extracellular matrix.

go:term.go:name: host cell extracellular matrix binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with the extracellular matrix of a host cell.

go:term.go:name: glycosaminoglycan binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with any glycan (polysaccharide) containing a substantial proportion of aminomonosaccharide residues.

go:term.go:name: heparin binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with heparin, any member of a group of glycosaminoglycans found mainly as an intracellular component of mast cells and which consist predominantly of alternating alpha1-4-linked D-galactose and N-acetyl-D-glucosamine-6-sulfate residues.

go:term.go:name: hyaluronic acid binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with hyaluronic acid, a polymer composed of repeating dimeric units of glucuronic acid and N-acetyl glucosamine.

go:term.go:name: hemoglobin binding
go:term.go:definition: Interacting selectively with hemoglobin, an oxygen carrying, conjugated protein containing four heme groups and globin.
